timeline.bodyText: Aaah. It seems that IDEA rereads the settings from .editorconfig all the time.
timeline.author: palesz
costin

timeline.bodyText: Please format only the touched lines - there's a plugin/setting for IDEA that does that.
timeline.author: costin

replies.bodyText: For those such changes that touch code lines, it adds some more effort when checking the git history, or simply "blame". On the other hand, personally I have no problem when deleting whitespaces from empty lines, as long as it's in the touched files.
replies.author: matriv

timeline.bodyText: Extra space missing, should be (Alias) ne
timeline.author: costin

timeline.bodyText:
The initial code was using a Map of attributes, the change uses a List of Aliases which are then converted into a Map.
The use of streams doesn't seem to simplify things either - instead of one iteration there are too.
This needs reworking - just create an AttributeMap with the children and then combine that with the existing aliases.
timeline.author: costin

replies.bodyText: Ok, now that there is no chance of overwrite that makes more sense.
replies.author: palesz

timeline.author: costin

replies.bodyText: Seems I have to disable the EditorConfig, otherwise IDEA is too clever the resets these settings.
replies.author: palesz

timeline.bodyText: A builder should just assemble a state, not question it's in-transit state.
timeline.author: costin

timeline.bodyText:
Shouldn't be called on a builder. Optimizations are good but in this case they simply get in the way.
Create two AttributeMaps if needed.
timeline.author: costin

timeline.bodyText: This change is not needed - there's no value in holding the alias reference.
timeline.author: costin

timeline.bodyText:
Why not return the map directly? AttributeMap is immutable.
To guarantee that the builder is not used after build() is called, a flag could be used instead of copying things over.
timeline.author: costin

replies.bodyText: Changed, won't copy on .build(), only will copy once on the first .put() after a .build().
replies.author: palesz

replies.bodyText: Removed the defensive copy completely: c4e3fc4
replies.author: palesz

timeline.message: Change behaviour: do not copy on each `build()`
